import React, { useState } from "react"; const InsulationPerformance = ({ data, onDataChange, onNext, onBack }) => { const [formData, setFormData] = useState({ wallType: data.wallType || "", externalWallInsulation: data.externalWallInsulation || "", roofInsulation: data.roofInsulation || "", windowType: data.windowType || "", floorInsulation: data.floorInsulation || "", ...data }); const handleChange = (e) => { const { name, value } = e.target; const updatedData = { ...formData, [name]: value }; setFormData(updatedData); onDataChange({ [name]: value }); }; // Validation function const isFormValid = () => { return formData.insulationQuality && formData.windowType && formData.bedrooms && formData.mainWallType; }; return (

Insulation Performance

Tell us about your home's insulation and construction details to calculate accurate energy efficiency and heating requirements.

Insulation Quality

How would you rate your home's overall insulation quality?

Window Type

What type of windows does your home have?

Property Size

How many bedrooms does your property have?

Wall Construction

What type of walls does your property have?

💡 Energy Efficiency Tips

Insulation

Good insulation can reduce heating costs by up to 40%. Focus on loft, cavity walls, and floor insulation for maximum impact.

Windows

Double glazing can reduce heat loss by 50% compared to single glazing. Triple glazing offers even better performance.

Drafts

Sealing gaps around windows, doors, and other openings can improve comfort and reduce energy bills significantly.

Wall Insulation

Cavity wall insulation is one of the most cost-effective home improvements, often paying for itself within 2-5 years.

); }; export default InsulationPerformance;
